answers.answer: I am diabetic and only 21 was born with Hyperglycaemia and I have had a miss carriage before I am worried about this one because I am only 6 weeks and you still can miscarry till 12 weeks apparently
I'm 26 this is my 2nd Pregnancy my first pregnancy I had a stillborn at eight and a half months I'm so scared....
I'm 26 this is my 2nd Pregnancy my first pregnancy I had a stillborn at eight and a half months I'm so scared....
How are you guys doing this week?

Hello Everyone,I am 44 (nearly45) and I think I am now pregnant with my 3rd.  I will know for sure in 1 or 2 days.  I know that I am pregnant because my blood sugar has been increasing exponentially since the day I ovulated 11 days ago and I've had to increase my insulin dose from about 20 units/ day to now more than 60.  And this is just the second week!This will be my 3rd diabetic pregnancy.My first is now 6 1/2.  My second is 3 1/4, and this one will be due at the end of March next year.  Both were normal weight and absolutely no diabetes related complications.

My blood sugars have been super low the last two weeks. Can't eat. Vomit all the time. But I am now at 8 weeks. My Lantus shots have dropped from 90 units at bed to 78 today. I went to the mat ward yesterday and they admitted me to the nausea and vomiting clinic. Everyone was super helpful,  hooked up the iv got me fluids, gravol and vitamins. Today I felt great. I am super encouraged to hear of your previous 2 successfully pregnancies super_sally888. I am super worried I will miss carry again as I am not sure I could put myself thru all this missery again.

question: I am 33 years old. Diabetic for 23 years. This is my second pregnancy in 2015. Miscarried my first baby in May earlier this year, just found out last week I am pregnant again. Now I am scared ********. Was so devistated after I lost the first one. Anyone else going thru this?JamieJean
title: Any Diabetic Expecting Mamma's?
